intro: Strobilanthes pentastemonoides var. multidens, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame flower," is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames, composed of numerous tubular flowers. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its vibrant orange to red floral display. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
